concept.initial_blurb: Think about your Mythos. In the legend, was your Mythos responsible for protecting something? Was she able to withstand punishment or endure great toils? Was she a unique being or creature with superhuman durability? What exactly were her powers?
concept.question: How does your Mythos protect its agenda?

improvements.description: When you Face Danger with power tags from this theme, it's Dynamite!
improvements.name: Unbreakable

improvements.description: When you burn a tag in this theme for a hit in order to Face a Danger affecting you and your allies, allies who can benefit from your protection don't roll Face Danger but use your result instead.
improvements.name: Got your Back

improvements.description: When you get a hit on Face Danger, you can always choose to extend the outcome to one person or object around you that you can protect, at the cost of exposing yourself. On a 10+, they take no status and you take the status with -1 tier. On 7-9, they take the status with -1 tier and you take the full status. If the move is Dynamite!, on a 12+, you can choose to fully protect both of you (instead of one of the other 12+ options).
improvements.name: Sacrifice

improvements.description: When your Face Danger move is Dynamite!, on a 12+, you can choose the following option instead of the other options: you absorb the harmful effect or disable its source, granting either you or your opponent an appropriate temporary tier-2 status of your choice.
improvements.name: Sorry, was that your gun?

improvements.description: When your Face Danger move is Dynamite!, on a 12+, if you choose to reflect the status you were given, you can redirect it to any target, not just your attacker
improvements.name: Redirected Hostility
